thread.title: The Gaslight Anthem's Brian Fallon announces solo album
thread.title_full: The Gaslight Anthem's Brian Fallon announces solo album | NJ.com

author: Bobby Olivier | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: The Gaslight Anthem's Brian Fallon announces solo album
text:
NEW BRUNSWICK — The Gaslight Anthem are expected to be quiet for the foreseeable future, following a hiatus announcement in July.
But gravelly frontman Brian Fallon — known to push side projects when his New Brunswick rockers are off — will keep the music coming, this time under his own name.
Fallon announced Tuesday his debut solo album "Painkillers" will be released early next year. By moniker alone, the record could act as a resolve to Gaslight's most recent album, 2014's "Get Hurt."
Fallon will record with Butch Walker, whose producer credits include works from Fall Out Boy, Avril Lavigne and Fallon's pal Frank Turner. The album will be released via Island Records, as was "Get Hurt."
The 35-year-old Red Bank native announced a crop of January shows, prefaced by three shows at Crossroads in Garwood Dec. 3-5. He will tour with Gaslight guitarist Alex Rosamilia, as well as Ian Perkins and Catherine Popper, with whom Fallon worked with on side project Molly and the Zombies.
